result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M Holt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DE to complete an AODA assessment and complete any follow up recommended.

No contact with the victim without the victim and Agent approval

DE will maintain absolute sobriety

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 

No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician. 

DE will complete  Anger management counseling.

DE will complete an AODA assessment and any follow up recommended.

DE will pay court costs, provide DNA and pay restitution.

DE will have 4 days credit if revoked. 

22GF3 consolidated into 22CF37

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher M Holt

records.addlTxt: Letter dated 6/27/22 from DOC requesting review of Ct 3

4:00 PM     Prosecuting attorney Emily Margaret Nelson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher M Holt appeared by video.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow appeared by video for Christopher M Holt.   The victim J.G. appeared via video.  Matter set for PH.    Parties have reached an agreement.    Both cases heard 21CM156 and 22CF37 heard at the same time.  DE entered a NC plea to Misd. Battery (22CF37-amended count 1), DC-Count 2 (22CF37)   and 21CM156 DC-Domestic.  Guilty Plea Questionnaires on file.  DE is aware of his rights and understands.   DE stipulated to factual basis.  Court finds factual basis to accept pleas and accepted pleas.   Court finds DE guilty of charges.    Joint recommendation as to sentence.   Victim JG made a statement to the Court.    DE made a statement to the Court.  Court ordered 9 mo. imposed and stayed, probation ordered 24 mos.   w/conditions no contact with victim unless approved by Prob. Agent, absolute sobriety, AODA assessment and follow through, pay restitution as agreed upon, DNA sample and surcharges.   Court granted 4 days jail credit.  Adj. 4:15 PM.

PD Cook asking for a $500.00 sign bond, DE resides locally, is employed and has young children in his care, asks for incidential contact be allowed with JMG.
